Class WaterTheme

java.lang.Object
WaterTheme
public final class WaterTheme extends Object
Theme utilities for building a cohesive "water" look invalid input: '&' feel across Swing windows.

This final class provides:

  • Brand colors and fonts,
  • Factory methods for gradient backgrounds, card panels, and wave headers,
  • Styling helpers for buttons, text fields, and scroll panes, and
  • A simple hover effect installer for buttons.

Painting: Custom components created here override paintComponent (and sometimes paintBorder) to draw gradients, waves, bubbles, and rounded outlines with antialiasing.

Threading: As with all Swing UI code, construct and use the returned components on the Event Dispatch Thread (EDT).

Since:
1.0

  • Method Details

    • titleFont

      public static Font titleFont()
      Returns the default title font used by headers and card titles.
      Returns:
      a bold Arial font sized 18pt

    • bodyFont

      public static Font bodyFont()
      Returns the default body font used by labels and inputs.
      Returns:
      a plain Arial font sized 14pt

    • createGradientBackground

      public static JPanel createGradientBackground(LayoutManager layout)
      Creates a panel with a vertically blended ocean-like gradient, layered soft waves, and subtle "bubbles". The provided layout manager is applied to the panel.

      The panel paints with antialiasing and multiple translucent overlays to achieve depth.

      Parameters:
      layout - layout manager to apply to the returned panel
      Returns:
      a non-opaque JPanel that repaints a themed gradient background

    • createCardPanel

      public static JPanel createCardPanel(String title, LayoutManager layout)
      Creates a semi-transparent rounded "card" panel with an optional title header and the specified layout manager. The card renders a light outline and padding suitable for content.
      Parameters:
      title - optional title to display in the card's header (left-aligned)
      layout - layout manager for the card's content area
      Returns:
      a non-opaque JPanel styled as an information card

    • createWaveHeader

      public static JComponent createWaveHeader(String title, String subtitle)
      Creates a horizontal header component with a vertical gradient (accent → primary), a translucent wave overlay, and stacked title/subtitle labels.
      Parameters:
      title - main heading text (left-aligned; may be null or empty)
      subtitle - smaller descriptive text beneath the title (optional)
      Returns:
      a non-opaque JComponent sized to header height

    • stylePrimaryButton

      public static void stylePrimaryButton(AbstractButton button)
      Applies "primary" styling to a button: solid brand background, white text, rounded border, hand cursor, and no focus painting (Basic L&F).
      Parameters:
      button - the button to style (non-null)

    • styleSecondaryButton

      public static void styleSecondaryButton(AbstractButton button)
      Applies "secondary" styling to a button: light background, dark blue text, subtle rounded border, hand cursor, and no focus painting (Basic L&F).
      Parameters:
      button - the button to style (non-null)

    • installButtonHoverEffect

      public static void installButtonHoverEffect(AbstractButton button)
      Installs a simple hover effect that brightens the button's background when the pointer enters, and restores it on exit.
      Parameters:
      button - the button to decorate

    • styleTextField

      public static void styleTextField(JTextField field)
      Applies a consistent border and font styling to a text field.
      Parameters:
      field - the JTextField to style

    • styleScrollPane

      public static void styleScrollPane(JScrollPane pane)
      Applies theme styling to a scroll pane by setting a white viewport background and a rounded, light-blue border.
      Parameters:
      pane - the JScrollPane to style
